Linear Model¶

class slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression¶
compute_cost(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression, X: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, n], flags.writeable, flags.c_contiguous], y: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, 1], flags.writeable], lambda: float = 0) → float¶

Compute cost given X, y and lambda (regularization parameter).

compute_cost_with_aug_feature(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression, X_plus: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, n], flags.writeable, flags.c_contiguous], y: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, 1], flags.writeable], lamda: float = 0) → float¶

Compute cost given X_plus, y and lambda (regularization parameter).

constant_init(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression, size: int, value: float) → None¶

Init parameters with size, and the same value

fit(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression, X: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, n], flags.writeable, flags.c_contiguous], y: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, 1], flags.writeable], threshold: float = 0.1, fit_intercept: bool = True, lambda: float = 0) → float¶

Fit the linear model based on X, y, cost difference threshold and lambda (regularization parameter).

gaussian_init(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression, size: int, mu: float = 0, sigma: float = 1) → None¶

Init parameters with size, and gaussian distribution

gradient_descent(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression, X: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, n], flags.writeable, flags.c_contiguous], y: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, 1], flags.writeable], iterations: int, learning_rate: float, check_learning_rate: bool = False, lambda: float = 0) → float¶

Use gradient descent to tune the parameters given X, y and learning_rate.

normal_equation(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression, X: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, n], flags.writeable, flags.c_contiguous], y: numpy.ndarray[float64[m, 1], flags.writeable]) → float¶

Use normal equation to tune the parameters given X and y.

print_parameters(self: slearn.linear_model.LinearRegression) → None¶

Print the parameters in the linear regression model
